siminsee 0.1.0
  • Reference

We simulate different trials with possibly different parameters specified in arguments for each scenario

nlisttrial.Rd

We simulate different trials with possibly different parameters specified in arguments for each scenario

Usage

nlisttrial(
  scenario = 1,
  nrepeat = 1,
  nbp = 1000,
  tacc = 60,
  tfu = 60,
  lambda0 = 0.03,
  HR = 1,
  lambda_pdv1 = 0.01,
  lambda_pdv2 = 0.02,
  t_pdv2 = 36,
  HR_pdv = 1,
  pinsee0 = 0.95,
  pinsee1 = 0.95,
  seed = 2023
)

Arguments

scenario

: the number of the scenarios (default 1 scenario)

nrepeat

: a vector containing the number of repetitions for each scenario (default 1 repetition)

nbp

: a vector containing the number of patients for each scenario (defaut 1,000 patients)

tacc

: a vector containing the accrual duration in months for each scenario (default 60 months)

tfu

: a vector containing the follow-up duration in months for each scenario (default 60 months)

lambda0

: a vector containing the rate of the exponential distribution for each scenario (default 0.03)

HR

: a vector containing the Hazard Ratio for survival between group 0 and group 1 for each scenario (default 1)

lambda_pdv1

: a vector containing the rate of lost to follow-up for patients until time 't_pdv2' for each scenario (default 0.01)

lambda_pdv2

: a vector containing the rate of lost to follow-up for patients after time 't_pdv2' for each scenario (default 0.02)

t_pdv2

: a vector containing the time at which rate of lost to follow-up changes for each scenario (default 36)

HR_pdv

: a vector containing the Hazard ratio for lost to follow-up between group 0 and group 1 for each scenario (default 1)

pinsee0

: a vector containing the administrative file completeness (insee) in group 0 for each scenario (default 0.95)

pinsee1

: a vector containing the administrative file completeness (insee) in group 1 for each scenario (default 0.95)

seed

: seed used to generate each scenario

Value

the function returns a simulation dataset with all the scenarios
